content:
The joint address of the Prosecutor General Andriy Kostin and the Minister of Justice and the Prosecutor General of Poland Adam Bodnara concerns Ukrainians and Ukrainian women who are currently in Poland.

About thisreported March 8Office of the Prosecutor General.

"If you have survived the military crimes of Russia or become their witness, inform the nearest police station at your place of residence or prosecutor's office," the address said.

It indicates that any data is important: shows, photos, videos. Every fact can be crucial to proving the guilt of military criminals.

Adam Bodnar assured that Poland was very actively involved in the process of investigating the war crimes committed in Ukraine.
